text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Today, our summer camp begins.<n>We'll be spending the
next few<n>weeks getting in some good training<n>by the
beach.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: ...Or at least, that was the plan.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I have a sudden urge to prove a<n>theory that I've been
losing sleep<n>formulating. But before we start the<n>
experiment—

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Trainer, how are you feeling?! Your<n>body temperature?
Hours slept? Food<n>consumed?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Your condition could greatly affect the<n>results, you see. As
such, I must<n>record this data before the<n>experiment!
choice_data_list: Weren't we going to train tod—

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Heh-heh... My theory concerns the<n>increase of running
speeds. You could<n>call it another form of training!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: Though, you'll be the one putting in<n>the work.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: Ahahaha! Don't worry, this time<n>you'll stay conscious.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
All right, first we'll measure the<n>energy consumption of your
organs<n>under extreme stress. Then we'll<n>crank things up
step by step—

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Tachyon continues talking to herself.<n>Looks like she has no
intention of<n>partaking in normal training.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
—Which is why it's about time you<n>stopped subscribing to
the tired notion<n>that summer camp means a montage<n>of us
running along the beach. Try to<n>think outside the box.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
There's no time for us to be twiddling<n>our thumbs when we
should be<n>pursuing the limits of speed. Now, let<n>us begin
the experiment!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
First, we'll utilize the incline of this<n>road to stimulate your<n>
cardiopulmonary functions!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
To get good data, you'll need to run<n>to the beach and back
at least three<n>times.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Is your measuring instrument ready?<n>It'll record your
oxygen levels once a<n>lap, so don't forget it.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Also, no matter how exhausted you<n>get—don't stop running.
I want data<n>from when you're near your limit.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
What? All you have to do is empty<n>your mind and run like a
hamster on a<n>wheel!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
But you are only a guinea pig, so I'm<n>not expecting you to
run as well as a<n>hamster.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Fear not—I'll be accompanying you.<n>Someone has to make
sure you don't<n>veer off course.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: ...And there goes my last hope of<n>escape.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Come on, you can do it, Trainer! Lift<n>those thighs higher!
Right—keep up this<n>pace!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Keep your breathing steady!<n>Otherwise, you'll make things
harder<n>on yourself.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Ahaha! Excellent, are you near your<n>limit? We still have two
laps to go!<n>Just a little bit more!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Hm... You suffered greater muscle<n>fatigue than I had
expected. Your legs<n>aren't shaking, but I can see that<n>
you're trying your best to keep<n>standing.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Okay then, let's move on to the next<n>experiment. I want to
collect data on<n>your respiratory organs as you run up<n>a
slope in this state.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Heh-heh, this will be a gold mine of<n>data! This could open
the door to the<n>potential we seek—the precursor to<n>
something great!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Or, it would've been. Looking at you,<n>you're not almost at
your limit—you're<n>past it.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
It appears my calculations were off.<n>Since we can't get the
data right now,<n>we'll have to reschedule the<n>experiment.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I have no complaints if you wish to<n>continue. But I'd rather
use this time<n>to perform another experiment than<n>record
unnecessary data.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: That said, I don't seem to be carrying<n>anything useful. Hm...
choice_data_list: Can we use seawater for anything?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
...Seawater, you say? Of course,<n>swimming isn't the only
thing you can<n>do in the ocean. But what are we to<n>do
without the right tools?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: Don't tell me you were thinking of<n>drinking it?
choice_data_list:
Maybe we could freeze it and use it to ice
injuries?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Icing... Considering today's weather,<n>the temperature of the
ocean must be<n>over twenty-five degrees Celsius. Not<n>the
ideal temperature for ice.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Hm, your idea is banal yet has its<n>merits. For instance, I
never would've<n>come up with that idea myself.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
By focusing the water on your muscle<n>contractions, we
could collect new<n>data—No, that would only retain heat.<n>
Hm...

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I've decided! The ocean possesses<n>its own unique salinity,
buoyancy, and<n>tidal friction. We must verify how your<n>
body will react to these elements!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I see, this is very interesting data<n>indeed. Not quite enough
to prove my<n>theory...

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
But if I focus my research in this<n>direction, then surely a
breakthrough<n>is inevitable!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Heh-heh-heh... This will work, I'm<n>sure of it! Trainer, it's
time to compile<n>the data! Lend me a hand!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
We return to the dorm and begin<n>sifting through today's
data. Of<n>course, we pull an all-nighter<n>experimenting as
well.

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text: The next day...

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text: Yawn... A good morning to you,Trainer!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I must express my gratitude for your<n>cooperation. Thanks to
you, I was able<n>to develop a new medicine based on<n>my
theory.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Regrettably, it's still only on paper. I<n>don't have my tools
here at camp, so<n>production will have to wait until we<n>
return to the academy.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
But before that, I'd like to get your<n>opinion on something.
Did you notice<n>anything from our research last night?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I especially want to hear about ways<n>to increase the
efficiency of supplying<n>oxygen to the muscles during<n>
contraction. Tell me all that you know.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
You see, there's a certain value in the<n>opinion of an
amateur. Your opinions<n>are novel—even your simple<n>
questions spark my interest.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Most importantly, you're the only one<n>who goes along with
my experiments.<n>I'm expecting great things from you,<n>my
guinea pig assistant!

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
You're a capable test subject, and<n>your perspective is
invaluable.<n>Holistically speaking, what are you if<n>not my
assistant?

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Guinea pigs and assistants are<n>equally invaluable to a
researcher like<n>myself. So if you ever have an<n>interesting
thought, share it with me!<n>I'm all ears!
choice_data_list:
I see you're finally listening to what I have to
say.

I see you're finally listening to what I have to
say.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Oh, have I not been? Hm, perhaps we<n>could call this another
step towards<n>the potential we seek.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
Rejoice, Trainer! This single step will<n>indubitably lead us
down a greater<n>path.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
And with that out of the way, let us<n>resume our
experiments! Our time<n>here is finite, after all.

text_block_list.name: Agnes Tachyon
text_block_list.text:
I miscalculated yesterday, but this<n>time I'll work you to the
brink of your<n>limit! Let us begin, Trainer!

text_block_list.name: Monólogo
text_block_list.text:
Tachyon makes me run despite my<n>lack of sleep, and
before I know it,<n>I've reached my limit once again...
